means: 远远高于，远远超过( tower的现在分词)
（在能力、品德、名声等方面）胜过，远远超过（其他人）

sentence.Network_en: I saw her in a towering rage only once.
sentence.Network_cn: 我只有一次见过她大发雷霆。

sentence.Network_en: The burly brute swaggered forward, towering over me, and shouted.
sentence.Network_cn: 五大三粗的恶汉趾高气扬地走过来，居高临下地对我咆哮着。

sentence.Network_en: He remains a towering figure in modern British politics.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在现代英国政坛上一直是位杰出的人物。

The village is named after mountain towering in front of it ., 这个村庄是以矗立在它前面的那座高山命名的.

东京铁塔的缤纷盛宴说到东京，脑海中的第一个印象就是东京铁塔（Tokyo Tower），也是东京最早开始的圣诞点灯活动，迎接圣诞佳 …
西尔斯大厦（Sears Tower）官方表示，摩天台（Skydeck，译注：位于103层，对公众开放）的窗玻璃每周都会留下数以百计的游客 …

entry.def: If you describe something such as a mountain or cliff as towering, you mean that it is very tall and therefore impressive.

example.ex: ...towering cliffs of black granite which rise straight out of the sea.
example.tran: 从海里突兀而起的参天的黑色花岗岩峭壁

entry.def: If you describe someone or something as towering, you are emphasizing that they are impressive because of their importance, skill, or intensity.

example.ex: He remains a towering figure in modern British politics...
example.tran: 他在现代英国政坛上一直是位杰出的人物。

example.ex: I saw her in a towering rage only once.
example.tran: 我只有一次见过她大发雷霆。

means.word_mean: 1. of imposing height; especially standing out above others;

auth_sentence.content: Grove has his eyes fixed on the towering rig.

sentences.en: In the distance loomed a towering mountain.
sentences.cn: 在远处一座巍峨的高山隐约可见。
白雪皑皑的山峰耸入云霄。

sentences.en: The towering pine and cypress trees defy frost and snow.
We looked up at the rocky peaks towering above us.
sentences.cn: 我们抬头观望高高耸立的遍布岩石的山峰。

sentences.en: He was in a towering rage.
He was in a towering rage about his lost watch.
sentences.cn: 他因丟了手表而暴怒不已。

sentences.en: Beethoven was a towering musical genius.
sentences.cn: 贝多芬是一个伟大的音乐天才。
